==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|かわ|はた|k2=ばた|r=y|yomi=k}}

===Etymology===
[[川]] (kawa) "river" + [[側]]/[[端]]/[[傍]] (hata) "edge"

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かわばた|hhira=かはばた}}

# [[riverbank|Riverbank]].
#* '''1593:''' ''Esopono fabulas'' ([[w:Aesop's Fables|Aesop's Fables]]), "Vôcameto, fitcujino tatoyeno coto" (The Wolf and The Lamb)
#*: Aru '''cauabata'''ni vôcamemo, fitcujimo mizzuuo nomuni, ... <!-- should fitcujimo be fitçujimo? -->
#*: (= ある川端にオオカメも、ヒツジも水を飲むに、…)
#*: (On a certain riverbank, a wolf and a sheep go to drink water) <!--"go to" implicit from に-->
#* '''1632:''' [[w:Diego Collado|Diego Collado]], ''Dictionarium Sive Thesauri Linguae Iaponicae Compendium'', p. 117 (mislabelled 118)
#*: ''Ripa, æ: ribera y orilla de rio.'' '''cavãbata'''.
